summary: Joseph Timothy White is a PFC who reportedly defected to North Korea. The documents detail his background, including his ROTC enrollment, military police apprehension, enlistment in the US Army National Guard, and academic record. He attended Kemper Military School & College (KMSC), where he was known by Joseph C. Merlino. An agent report details an interview with Henry D. Glaister concerning White, focusing on White's background, associations, and political views during his time at KMSC. There is also a re-contact of Henry D. Glaister to obtain written permission for the release of a previous agent report concerning Joseph T. White to White's father. The documents suggest an investigation into White's background and potential defection.
significance: The significance of Joseph Timothy White in the JFK context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. However, the investigation into his background and reported defection to North Korea suggests potential counterintelligence concerns during the Cold War era, which may have been relevant to broader security investigations at the time, though a direct link to the JFK assassination is not evident from these documents alone.
